item.title: [Class Rework] The Priest (BD Support)
item.dc:creator: Loudo
item.description:
LunickTMM:

I do wish we had a new conversion prevention class. I think old CW was too strong with two blocks, but I think someone with one would be fine.

I don’t, to be honest. Balancing the game around conversions is already a headache, having a class that prevents conversion throws everything under the bus (because its presence or absence in the game has too much of an impact).

Besides there are already ways to combat conversions: the Prince’s jail, the Court Wizard’s swaps, and the Paladin’s Smite. The Sheriff’s Scout doesn’t prevent conversions but it does discourage it somehow (if you yell “Please Scout on me”, the MM probably won’t convert you if he suspects another Sheriff is present.)
Also, if you are playing against Cult, anyone that sneezes in the Cult Leader’s direction can block conversions. XD

item.title: [Class Rework] The Priest (BD Support)
item.dc:creator: LunickTMM
item.description:
Unseen/Cult get a lot of power from knowing who their other members are. Anyone who removes conversion is far too powerful, as that information is revealed. If there is a psychic in play, the newly formed Death Knight can tell Psychic who all the unseen are, since that’s his new goal.

Even without a Psychic, the Death Knight can leave a death note when he kills a confirmed Unseen, since he knows who they are, and then write in his death note who the rest of his ex team mates are. It’s immensely too powerful.

I do wish we had a new conversion prevention class. I think old CW was too strong with two blocks, but I think someone with one would be fine.

I’d also add the day ability is a bit strong, as it prevents a player from converting or getting converted with no down sides to you. Most blocking abilities come with some risk, but there is none here.
